questions.question_text:
An engineer configured a new network identity in Cisco Umbrella but must verify that traffic is being routed through the Cisco Umbrella network.
Which action tests the routing?

choices.B: Enable the Intelligent Proxy to validate that traffic is being routed correctly.
choices.D: Browse to http://welcome.umbrella.com/ to validate that the new identity is working.
choices.A: Ensure that the client computers are pointing to the on-premises DNS servers.
choices.C: Add the public IP address that the client computers are behind to a Core Identity.

discussion.content:
Correct Answer: Browse to http://welcome.umbrella.com/ to validate that the new identity is working. 
According to dump: Enable the Intelligent Proxy to validate that traffic is being routed correctly.
Verify that your DNS connections are routed through Cisco Umbrella's global network by navigating to the following page in your client's browser: https://welcome.umbrella.com/.
You should see the Welcome to Umbrella page.
Note: You may need to restart your client's network interface or your computer. https://docs.umbrella.com/deployment-umbrella/docs/protect-your-network#section-step-4-test-yournetwork

It says one needs to verify that traffic is routing through umbrella. Redirection is done with the intelligent proxy and the verification site is http://proxy.opendnstest.com. Therefore none of the answers are correct.
answer is D. the welcome.umbrella.com is a testing URL that can help to verify that your using umbrella

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D to test if Umbrella is protecting your network

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D

questions.question_text: How does Cisco Umbrella archive logs to an enterprise-owned storage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Where are Logs Stored?
When you create a policy, activity logs are by default saved to the North America – California, US location of Umbrella's data warehouse. You can change the location of the data warehouse to Europe at any time.

You can also optionally configure logging so that logs are also stored to an Amazon S3 bucket—either your own or one managed by Cisco.

Selected Answer: D
It is D. https://docs.umbrella.com/deployment-umbrella/docs/log-management says you can also save your logs to an Amazon S3 Bucket.

choices.C: by the system administrator downloading the logs from the Cisco Umbrella web portal
choices.D: by being configured to send logs to a self-managed AWS S3 bucket
choices.B: by sending logs via syslog to an on-premises or cloud-based syslog server
choices.A: by using the Application Programming Interface to fetch the logs

questions.question_text: In which type of attack does the attacker insert their machine between two hosts that are communicating with each other?

discussion.content: The AsyncOS API is used for content security. It is a set of REST APIs provided by Cisco to enable integration and automation of content security features, such as email and web security, into third-party applications or management systems. The AsyncOS API allows developers to interact with the content security platform, retrieve information, and perform actions such as blocking or quarantining emails or URLs based on various criteria.
